result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Philip M. Pyke was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 days to pay or CV Judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person with Atty Ted Kmiec.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1100 - DE enters plea of guilty as to Ct2 - found guilty by the court. Cts 1, 3 dismissed outright. PSI waived. Sentence recommendations made. DE to serve 6 months in KCJ w/huber. Court orders a $1500 fine plus costs, due in 30 days from the date of release from custody or civil judgment.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  DL revoked for 27 months. Ignition interlock ordered. Intox assessment ordered.  Appeal rights, Voters rights, Firearms warning given.
Due to ongoing JT - PLEAS rescheduled to 4/15/16 @ 10:30am. Attys confirm by email. Atty Kmiec's office to notify DE of new hearing date/time.
from WCS. Program requirements satisfied.
